pros: Friendly culture, great managers and coworkers

pros: Interacting with patients and family members is rewarding.

pros: Evangelical offered great benefits and my supervisors were always very helpful.
cons: Nothing against the company, but the position was repetitive and boring.

review_title: Not what I was told it would be
job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in New Columbia, PA

cons: Not the hours I was told. No help from the nurses. And to many patients (17) by myself.

job_title: Registered Cardiovascular Invasive Specialist in Lewisburg, PA
pros: Never just a number at this facility, they care about their patients and staff and VP's and the CEO are familiar faces around the facility.
cons: Pay rate and call pay is not competitive with surrounding hospitals in specialty areas

pros: The co-workers are the best part of the job. Teamwork is strong at this facility.

pros: Private and not owned by insurance company

pros:
-hospital does market adjustment with pay
-gives employee Christmas gifts and holiday bonus
cons:
-raises are minimal
-understaffed
-doesn’t match too much with retirement

review_title: Unfair treatment, clicks, drama, & a  “Shake-my-Head” lack of common sense.
pros: Location. Select few people in other departments,  other than the nutrition department, had common sense and compassion.
cons: Management of the nutrition department has been in place for decades, and that appears to be due to a lack of desire to improve the department.

review_title: Small hospital, friendly people, bad management
pros: Raises and bonuses and market adjustments are pretty good.. comparable to surrounding hospitals. Very friendly staff. Patients enjoy a small intimate setting
cons: The Human Resources dept is terrible. They've let potential employees go because of their inability to respond the applicants. They never address problems or legitimate concerns within departments and among staff. The hospital would rather spend money on their own public image than supply employees with necessary things to do their jobs

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in West Hempstead, NY
pros: A lot of new learning experiences & opportunities for advancement. Co-workers are friendly and caring. Office environment is supportive.
cons: Pay rate is not enough for experienced, quality employees. Not able to cross-train with other departments. Hospital employees should not have to pay a deductible for services rendered through the Evan.

review_title: Comfortable place to work that trains there employees to perform better for quality patient care
pros: Small community Hospital where you get to know all the managers in your unit and others
cons: Lack of upward mobility in less you know someone Who is in a position of authority to move you into that job. They tend to give the job to their friends other than qualified applicants

pros: Small hospital - dedicated providers.  Nice surroundings. Good cafeteria.  Nice holiday meal.   Clean hospital. Can’t think of a lot of positives.
cons: No support for middle management. Promotion not based on skills or work ethic.  It’s all about who you know and not what you know.  Human Resources is not supportive of staff - they don’t follow their own rules.

pros: Great coworkers! Everyone is one big happy family. I love coming back to work when I'm home. I feel like everyone greets me with open arms.
cons: The nursing office management. It is hard to schedule sometimes and they make it difficult sometimes and forget/have you down for wrong dates/times

pros: Opportunity for learning. Continuing education provided.  Small hospital. Friendly patients. Very clean
cons: Management rules. Input is not appreciated and there are repercussions to employees who question their unit director.

pros: Absolutely the best  hospital I've ever worked for!! Great managers & loving environment for patients & employees alike!!!
cons: policy updates should be viewed and signed individually on each unit not placed on intranet where no one has time to view!!!
